bow: tired of the stigma around formula had very hard labor 30+ hours which ended in me and the baby getting sepsis me getting section and him in the nicu for few days as result my breast milk never fully came in the first month was able to give him some milk but had to supplement with formula from the beginning tried everything lactation specialists industrial grade pump hand expressing and herbal supplements it was just impossible… now keep hearing from other moms about how breast milk is the only way to go and how formula is poison and it makes me so angry……i had no choice and feel bad enough what do you other mommies think about this… sorry people are giving you hard time about this my milk came in fine but it did come out fast enough for my son he latched just fine but would unlatch after minute or two and scream until we gave him bottle it was just taste of what was to come despite the fact that pumped religiously could not keep up with him and had to use formula by the time he was weeks old by months he was drinking literally over twice what the average baby his size was drinking we could go by age by months he was in month clothes so we went by size we been giving him vitamins since he was born you know the vitamin stuff and added more other vitamins on the recommendation of our pediatrician at two months to no avail the only thing left to do was introduce solid foods early and hope that helped him because drinking over 100 ounces of formula breast milk day at months is really not what supposed to be happening gave up pumping entirely shortly after to sum up my son will be three in january he is currently in 4t and that size just barely fits him he can lift an entire gallon of liquid with one hand his speech was slightly delayed but it taken off at light speed recently and his comprehension of language has always been little ahead despite the fact that he was vocal he never been seriously sick in his life he had three or four colds and gotten stomach bug that lasted all of hours twice in his entire life he has no food allergies no weak stomach is not picky eater and does not require glasses could tell you single thing formula did to my son that was negative unless you want to blame the slight asthma he seems to get when he gets colds on formula which would be silly my husband has asthma and so does his mother in fact formula probably saved us since without it all would have had the option of giving him at *6 weeks* would have been solid foods besides that going straight to bottles allowed my husband to create closer bond with our son immediately breast milk has its benefits ca deny that but formula is going to hurt your son anyone giving you hard time with all you went through is more concerned about being superior from their standards than the health of your child ignore them or come up with some really stinging comebacks and use them all the time not being someone who takes the high road all the time vote for option number two formula has great purpose and your story is why without it some babies would starve and in other cases moms could be good moms ppl do think about the benefits of formula in some situations if it help have gotten the exact opposite for bfing past 6mo including that damaging my babies emotional health etc ppl seem to have special skill for making us feel like we re wrong regardless it sounds like you are really committed to your kid not sure would have tried all that and that will do more than any amount of bfing ever could totally understand was in labor for 26 hours and was so totally wiped out that did immediately try to get my son to breastfeed it might have been few hours before we tried and when when we did he just did *not* want to latch began supplementing formula there in the hospital because the poor little guy was just so hungry pumped breastmilk for maybe two weeks before going straight to formula he been sick once in his months with little viral thing like cold he started crawling at six months and he showing signs of wanting to walk now long story short feed your baby love the idea behind breastfeeding think it beautiful and all of that but formula is great too there have been lot of improvements in formula over the years with addition of vitamin and dha you re great mama feeding her baby would just say well would you like to donate some it either that or the baby starve right got any other amazing suggestions had terrible terrible guilt for year when had to come to terms with not being able to breastfeed anxiety depression the first year of her life was filled with so many dark moments for me already and then knowing could give her the one thing was supposed to still hate myself but she is so happy very much thriving and ahead in almost all areas of development so when the awkward questions come just say we do what is best for our family if they want the long horrible story they re welcome to listen and feel like shit after are people actually judging you or are you hearing these things out in the ether and feeling judged even though no one actually thinks less of you everything we do as parents is wrong to someone else formula breastmilk is just the first big one lot of us encounter an important lesson ve learned is that lot of the things that make me *feel* judged or like not doing things right are more about how *i* feel than how others feel in the end the most important things is your child happy and healthy growing do you love her people are trying to make you feel bad they re not even judging you lot of times these things are often about self motivation and psyching people up point to consider breastfeeding is really fucking hard sometimes you need to reinforce your decision to do it with stuff that may come across to others as judgemental because you need any shred of justification to keep going and on the flip side of the coin are all those women breastfeeding who catch hell from society about breastfeeding in public or why are they still doing it after months or omg it so gross that people actually breastfeed kids *who can ask for it my point for any stupid message you hear about how formula is wrong there is some poor bfing woman feeling equally harrassed and judged over her decision to breastfeed sorry it makes you feel bad really hope it does continue to make you feel bad because right now from what gather you have happy healthy baby who you are showering with love and care all this other stuff is just mommy wars shit seriously if not formula it crying it out vs bedsharing and elimination communication vs late toilet training and rice cereal vs baby led solids and million other things think it ridiculous what moms do to each other chose not to breastfeed have no interest in it whatsoever you better believe ve been judged for that by about everyone except my kids doctor go figure both my kids are happy and healthy and that all that matters the longer you re mom the easier it will be to let these things roll off your back just ignore them haters gon na hate its tough to formula feed in this day and age with both my children bf through about weeks and then switched to formula for my own sanity my first was collicky monster until gave in and tried formula and with my second could keep up with pumping and returning to work both of my children are bright and healthy with no allergies or health issues do sweat it the most beneficial time for breast milk is in the first few weeks you did what you could now go on and enjoy the benefits of formula feeding in the us the majority of us who are parents now were formula fed and our parents before us were too breast feeding was not the norm we survived maybe we all would have been hyper intelligent super
